p: Some Amaryllidaceae alkaloids also exhibited good growth inhibitory activities against several fungal pathogens and this activity was further investigated due to the emergence of drug-resistant strains and the loss of efficacy of existing antifungals [ 18]. Similarly, the antimalarial effect of some crinane alkaloids was investigated against various strains of the parasite Plasmodium falciparum and these studies afforded useful information on the anti-plasmodial pharmacophore [ 19].
